I look for films that have at least one l-o-n-g segment of a woman being slowly pleasured - a segment that I will want to re-watch for years to come. I care more about the visual impact of select scenes than I do about the artistic or historical aspects of the movie. I'm not likely to ever rewatch the entire movie after I find "the chapter" to replay. I'm giving this 5 stars because BOTH films have l-o-n-g segments of women being slowly pleasured with hands and tongues. :) In Expectations, there are two chapters that I replay - one (my fave) is man & woman, the other is 2 women.  In Confessions, the chapter I replay is woman on woman.  Having wasted $$ on dvds that lack anything I'd want to re-watch, I hit the jackpot with this double feature.

Expectations and Confessions of a Woman were both Anthony Spinelli directed movies which came out in 1977. Both movies feature attractive and demure brunettes as the stars and both films touch upon the theme of the philandering housewife who's stuck in a dead-end marriage and needs a little something to spice up their lives.

The first movie, Expectations, is the story of a bored housewife Margo (Delania Raffino) who answers an ad in an underground newspaper and switches identities with a free spirit, a `loose' woman Montana (Chris Cassidy). While the plot was thin, the scenes were hot. I was surprised at how Expectations touched upon taboo subjects such as sexual assault and incest. There was a scene between Raffino and Joey Silvera which, despite its brevity, was very intense. Another plus is the music. It isn't the typical music for an adult film. It was surprisingly good. When Margo is writing to her friend about her marriage the music strikes a solemn tone. When she has an interracial lesbian scene the music is upbeat.

The second feature, Confessions of a Woman, is the story of a housewife who's stuck in a boring marriage and decides to add excitement to her life. Some of the dialogue was crude. For instance, "I could look a lot better if I can get laid this morning," and, "Well, I've always had this fantasy where a man would pay an outrageous price just to be with me. Oh, I don't know. It might be every woman's fantasy." Wow. The star of the film, Kristine Heller, is in all of the scenes. Good opening scene between Heller and John Leslie. They had believable chemistry as a married couple. Another positive, much like Expectations, is the music. It fit the mood of the movie well.

In some ways, I prefer these movies over the stuff that we see today. Raffino and Heller both had this "good" girl look to them. They didn't look fake, plastic, over-the-top. These movies were solid intros into the world of retro porn of the 1970's.

I bought this DVD for one reason and one reason only and that is Chris Cassidy. A 1970's porn queen. A blonde bombshell with a reputation for hard,anything goes sex. Although,in this film; "Expectations", she is billed as Suzette Holland. She had other aliases as well. In fact"Chris Cassidy" is an alias. I would have preferred a double Chris Cassidy set. But this will do. The technical quality is good. The story is interesting. I would have to say,though, that for the viewer just looking to watch a porn DVD (and this is hard core porn) they would probably only rate it as average. The story is set in San Francisco (a hub for the  U.S. porn industry in the late 1970's) in 1977 and is about a swapping of identities between a bored young woman,Margot and a:"loose woman",Montana. Chris plays Montana(another porn alias).Margot is unsure about her new situation,Montana is a little too attached to her change of circumstances. For me, seeing 1970's vintage porn in technically good quality and seeing gorgeous  Chris in her prime is a delight. Why she frequently never shaved under her arms or on her legs has always intrigued me. She also usually had her hair in only one style. Long and parted in the middle. She was a natural blonde and never dyed her hair another colour. Although her real hair was probably darker than in her porn films. The "natural look" was a fashionable 1970's trend. Great also to see her facial expressions and some character lines on her forehead and face(no botox in 1977).In one scene there  is a poster, on the wall, of James Dean and another poster of Robert Redford. Robert Redford posters were also very popular in the 1970's. Montana's apartment is very 70's with the appropriate decor. It is a great apartment,with great posters. It was cheap in those days. These  days it would cost a fortune. Chris Cassidy was noted for doing hard scenes and lactating. Her scenes in this are not that hard but she does lactate. It is odd that a film that stars Chris Cassidy has such relatively mild sex scenes. I personally liked "Expectations" but I would say that it needed to be harder with more of an edge. Some people may find it boring. The technical quality of the other film;"Confessions" is also of a very high standard and has a similar theme to "Expectations".A bored young woman looking for sexual excitement. This film is a bit more interesting. The sex is a little harder,the story a little edgier. In the last scene there is a bottle of vitamin E on the table. In the 1970's this was regarded as a sexual tonic. I think this is an attempt at satire. Overall,these two films are average examples of 1970's porn. They both  needed more of an edge and harder sex scenes. The technical quality is fantastic(well done Vinegar Syndrome) and this is great. Although,  70's porn is quite readily available, these days,often the technical quality is so poor that it  ruins otherwise good films. Even though, I would only rate these films as average I would still much prefer them to the dreadful porn of today.
It's only been 2 weeks since I watched these 2 films. The DVD has already been resold and the only thing I can remember about either was that the XXX scenes were triple lame.

I found myself liking the 1st film more so than the 2nd one just based on the number of scenes and felt the girls were more attactive in the 1st movie than the 2nd. The second movie wasn't bad but the women were not as attactive to me as advertised by the box cover.
Getting two classic movies like these for one price was a bonus.  You do not see movies like these made today.  Definitely worth the purchase.

and ...  You name it.  She is boldly confessing her sex adventure.

This comes from 'back in the day' when porn was just beginning to blossom in the mass market, and made with the female audience in mind to some extent, but with very limited budgets - if that still holds some interest/excitement for you, then this is worth a look

I was taken by surprise by this one; the descriptions out there were rather scant and by the way that it's labeled, I had assumed that this would be a collection of cheap soft-core porn. It is in fact higher-end hard-core porn. So steer clear if that bothers you.

Both of these films, released in 1977 (which actually look and sound pretty darn good considering that--I've seen newer films with higher budgets that don't look this good), really push the envelope even from a pornographic perspective, with themes and scenes of incest, rape, anal sex, homosexuality, transsexuality, lactation, snowballing (seriously)...the list goes on and on. This stuff would shock a lot of audiences today, even ones who think that they're hardened to pornography--much less audiences in the mid '70s.

The movies run around 70 minutes each and feature two actually attractive women in the lead roles. I've seen other porn from the era in which the women are so ugly that they were hard to look at on the screen, but not so in this case. Too much hair, yes (especially the co-star of "Confession" who has more underarm hair than the men in the cast, yuck), but pretty women with nice bodies.

The plots, acting and scripts are first-rate stuff for this genre, and the themes are quite sophisticated. Far better than you would see from most hard-core today--or any era, most likely
